intro: Opulaster sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese opulaster, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. It has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and grows in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
